column4: at a guess either the code has a bug, or you're missing some header files or something
doesn't the app come with a 'configure' script ?
it comes with a makefile, if that's what you are referring to?
ah. then you need to read the docs to find out what libraries need to be installed for the compile
and then install -dev packages for those libraries
but it should've failed when trying to include files not present
it did fail, or so I think atleast...
and you commented out the #include line ? ;)
you probably need a linux-headers-* package, like linux-headers-386 or -686 or -k7 -- depending on your kernel image
it didn't work with the header files...
what does the output of 'uname -r' say ?
and what headers package did you install ?
you may specify the kernel source path with the
